content.question:
Computer output from a least-squares regression analysis based on a sample of size 17 is shown in the table.

Term 

<math alttext="coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext>COEF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="standard error of the coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mtext>SE Coef</mtext></mstyle></mstyle></mrow></math> 

<math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Constant 
7.43 
0.59 
12.59 

<math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold-italic"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> 
5.65 
1.14 
6.45 

Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following defines a 95 percent confidence interval for the slope of the least-squares regression line?

choices.label: <math alttext="5.65 plus or minus 1.96 times 1.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.65</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.96</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1.14</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="5.65 plus or minus 2.120 times 1.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.65</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.120</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1.14</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="5.65 plus or minus 2.131 times 1.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.65</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.131</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1.14</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="7.43 plus or minus 2.120 times 0.59" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.43</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.120</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.59</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="7.43 plus or minus 2.131 times 0.59" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.43</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.131</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.59</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5.65 plus or minus 2.131 times 1.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.65</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.131</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1.14</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
